lead_paragraph: Portland Trail Blazers forward LaMarcus Aldridge, the second pick in this year’s N.B.A. draft, will have surgery to repair a torn ligament in his right shoulder. The Blazers said in a statement that Aldridge’s recovery time would be determined after the procedure. Aldridge, 21, was acquired by Portland in a draft-day trade after being taken with the No. 2 pick by the Chicago Bulls. The 6-11 Aldridge played two seasons at the University of Texas and averaged 15 points and 9.2 rebounds as a sophomore.
